Plugins.Description: Reference for the Plugins section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.
Plugins.Details: This is not an exhaustive list of all plugins whose settings can be configured from the Project Settings window. Enabling and disabling plugins can add plugin-specific sections to the Project Settings window. If a plugin's settings don't appear in this section, refer to that plugin's documentation to learn more about the settings it supports.

AndroidFileServer.Description: Reference for the AndroidFileServer section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Use AndroidFileServer
Settings.Description: Enable the AndroidFileServer plugin.

Settings.Name: Allow Network Connection
Settings.Description: Allow FileServer connection using the network.

Settings.Name: Security Token
Settings.Description: Optional security token required to start FileServer (leave empty to disable).

Settings.Name: Include in Shipping
Settings.Description: Embed FileServer in Shipping builds.

Settings.Name: Allow External Start in Shipping
Settings.Description: Allow FileServer to be started in Shipping builds with UnrealAndroidFileTool.

Settings.Name: Compile AFSProject
Settings.Description: Compile standalone AFS project.

Settings.Name: Use Compression
Settings.Description: Enable compression during data transfer.

Settings.Name: Log Files
Settings.Description: Log transferred files.

Settings.Name: Report Stats
Settings.Description: Report transfer rate statistics.

Settings.Name: Connection Type
Settings.Description: Defines how to connect to the file server.

Settings.Name: Use Manual IP Address?
Settings.Description: Defines whether to use manual IP address instead of automatic query from device. Use only for single-device deploys.

Settings.Name: Manual IP Address
Settings.Description: IP address of the device to use.

AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

AVFMedia.Description: Reference for the AVF Media section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Native Audio Out
Settings.Description: Play audio tracks using the operating system's native sound mixer.

GeometryCache.Description: Reference for the Geometry Cache section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Look-Ahead Buffer (in seconds)
Settings.Description: The amount of animation (in seconds) to stream ahead of time (per stream).

Settings.Name: Maximum Memory Allowed (in MB)
Settings.Description: The maximum total amount of streamed data allowed in memory (for all streams).

AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

GooglePAD.Description: Reference for the GooglePAD section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Enable Plugin
Settings.Description: Enable GooglePAD plugin.

Settings.Name: Only Distribution
Settings.Description: Only for distribution builds.

Settings.Name: Only Shipping
Settings.Description: Only for shipping build.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

Groom.Description: Reference for the Groom section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Look-Ahead Buffer (in seconds)
Settings.Description: The amount of groom cache animation (in seconds) to pre-load ahead of time by the streaming manager.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

IMGMedia.Description: Reference for the IMG Media section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Default Frame Rate
Settings.Description: Default frame rate to use if none was specified in image sequence or media source (default = 1/24).

Settings.Name: Cache Behind Percentage
Settings.Description: Percentage of cache to use for frames behind the play head (default = 25%).

Settings.Name: Cache Size GB
Settings.Description: Maximum size of the look-ahead cache (in GB; default = 1 GB).

Settings.Name: Cache Threads
Settings.Description: Maximum number of image caching threads to use (0 = number of cores, default = 8).

Settings.Name: Global Cache Size GB
Settings.Description: Maximum size of the global look-ahead cache (in GB; default = 1 GB). Must be greater or equal to CacheSizeGB.

Settings.Name: Use Global Cache
Settings.Description: If enabled, uses the global cache.

Settings.Name: Cache Thread Stack Size KB
Settings.Description: Size of the stack for each caching thread (in kB; default = 128).

Settings.Name: Exr Decoder Threads
Settings.Description: Number of worker threads to use when decoding EXR images (0 = auto).

Settings.Name: Default Proxy
Settings.Description: Name of default media source proxy URLs (default = proxy). Proxies are used for lower-resolution media content during development.

Settings.Name: Use Default Proxy
Settings.Description: Defines whether to enable image sequence proxies (default = false).

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

LevelSequencer.Description: Reference for the Level Sequencer section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Tracks Settings
Settings.Description: Specifies class properties for which movie scene tracks will be created automatically.

Settings.Name: Auto Bind to PIE
Settings.Description: Specifies whether to automatically bind an active sequencer UI to PIE worlds.

Settings.Name: Auto Bind to Simulate
Settings.Description: Specifies whether to automatically bind an active sequencer UI to Simulate worlds.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

ModelingMode.Description: Reference for the Modeling Mode section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Enable Dynamic Mesh Actors
Settings.Description: Enables or disables the options to emit Dynamic Mesh Actors in Modeling Mode Tools.

Settings.Name: Default Mesh Object Type
Settings.Description: Defines the default Mesh Object type for Output Type Setting in Modeling Mode Tools.
Options: Static Mesh Asset: Generates a new Static Mesh Asset and AStaticMeshActor.
Volume Actor: Generates a new AVolume Actor.
Dynamic Mesh Actor: Generates a new ADynamicMeshActor stored locally in the Level.

Settings.Name: Asset Generation Mode
Settings.Description: Defines how auto-generated Assets by Modeling Tools are handled.
Options: Auto-Generate and Autosave: Automatically saves new Assets on creation.
Auto-Generate But Do Not Autosave: Marks new Assets as modified but doesn't save automatically.
Interactive Prompt to Save: Prompts to save each new Asset when created.

Settings.Name: Asset Generation Location
Settings.Description: Defines the folder where auto-generated Assets by Modeling Tools are stored.
Options: Auto-Generated World Relative Asset Path: Stored in a folder relative to the World.
Auto-Generated Global Asset Path: Stored in a root-level folder.
Current Asset Browser Path if Available: Stored in the current Content Browser folder or default path.

Settings.Name: Auto-Generated Asset Path
Settings.Description: Path where auto-generated Assets are stored, relative to the parent path. Set to an empty string to disable.

Settings.Name: Store Unsaved Level Assets in Top Level Game Folder
Settings.Description: If enabled, stores auto-generated Assets in an unsaved Level relative to the top-level /Game folder.

Settings.Name: Use Per-User Autogen Subfolder
Settings.Description: If enabled, stores auto-generated Assets in per-user folders below the auto-generated path.

Settings.Name: Autogen Subfolder User Name Override
Settings.Description: Overrides the user name used for per-user folders below the auto-generated path.

Settings.Name: Append Random String to Name
Settings.Description: If enabled, appends a short random string to auto-generated Asset names.

Settings.Name: Enable Persistent Selections
Settings.Description: Tracks selections between tools and visualizes with outlines. Experimental and disabled by default.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

Niagara.Description: Reference for the Niagara section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Additional Parameter Types
Settings.Description: Save a struct of parameters into the project for reuse in different Niagara scripts.

Settings.Name: Additional Payload Types
Settings.Description: Save a payload struct in your project to perform read and write events on it.

Settings.Name: Additional Parameter Enums
Settings.Description: Save an enum into your project for reuse in different Niagara scripts.

Settings.Name: Show Convertible Inputs in Stack
Settings.Description: Show variables of different types in the 'link input' menu if there is a conversion script.

Settings.Name: Systems Support Large World Coordinates
Settings.Description: Active effects rebase the simulation positions to not lose precision.

Settings.Name: Enforce strict type checks in the graph
Settings.Description: Types like positions and vectors can't be assigned to each other without an explicit conversion.

Settings.Name: Default Effect Type
Settings.Description: Default effect type to use for effects that don't define their own. Can be null.

Settings.Name: Position Pin Type Color
Settings.Description: Position pin type color. Other pin colors are defined in the general editor settings.

Settings.Name: System Viewport in Orbit Mode
Settings.Description: Sets the default navigation behavior for the system preview viewport.

Settings.Name: Quality Levels
Settings.Description: The quality levels Niagara uses.

Settings.Name: Component Renderer Warnings Per Class
Settings.Description: Info texts that the component renderer displays based on the selected component class.

Settings.Name: Default Render Target Format
Settings.Description: The default render target format used by all Niagara Render Target Data Interfaces unless overridden.

Settings.Name: Default Grid Format
Settings.Description: The default buffer format used by all Niagara Grid Data Interfaces unless overridden.

Settings.Name: Default Renderer Motion Vector Setting
Settings.Description: The default setting for motion vectors in Niagara renderers.

Settings.Name: Default Pixel Coverage Mode
Settings.Description: The default setting for pixel coverage mode when automatic is set on the Niagara Renderer.

Settings.Name: Gpu Max Bone Influences
Settings.Description: Controls the maximum number of influences that the Skeletal Mesh Data Interface can use on the GPU.

Settings.Name: Gpu Uniform Sampling Format
Settings.Description: Controls the format used for uniform sampling on the GPU.

Settings.Name: Adjacency Triangle Index Format
Settings.Description: Controls the format used for specifying triangle indexes in adjacency buffers.

Settings.Name: Allow Distance Fields (Experimental)
Settings.Description: Enables the Static Mesh data interface to sample from the distance field data on the GPU.

Settings.Name: Trace Provider Priorities (Experimental)
Settings.Description: Defines how traces tagged as Project Default are interpreted when using the AsyncGpuTrace data interface.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

NiagaraEditor.Description: Reference for the Niagara Editor section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Default Script
Settings.Description: Niagara script to duplicate as the base of all new script assets created.

Settings.Name: Default Dynamic Input Script
Settings.Description: Niagara script to duplicate as the base of all new dynamic input script assets created.

Settings.Name: Default Function Script
Settings.Description: Niagara script to duplicate as the base of all new function script assets created.

Settings.Name: Default Module Script
Settings.Description: Niagara script to duplicate as the base of all new module script assets created.

Settings.Name: Required System Update Script
Settings.Description: Niagara script required in the system update script to control system state.

Settings.Name: Graph Creation Shortcuts
Settings.Description: Shortcut key bindings that spawn the specified type of Niagara node when held down while clicking.

Settings.Name: Auto-Compile
Settings.Description: Defines whether auto-compile is enabled in the editor.

Settings.Name: Display Advanced Parameter Panel Categories
Settings.Description: Defines whether the Niagara Editor should display advanced categories for the parameter panel.

Settings.Name: Playback Speeds
Settings.Description: Speeds used for slowing down and speeding up the playback speeds.

Settings.Name: Curve Templates
Settings.Description: Default templates to quickly apply to curves in the Niagara curve editor.

Settings.Name: Enable Baker
Settings.Description: Enables the Niagara Baker to be used within the system editor.

Settings.Name: Auto-Play
Settings.Description: Defines whether the simulations should start playing automatically when the editor is opened or data is changed.

Settings.Name: Reset Simulation on Change
Settings.Description: Defines whether the simulation should reset when a value on the emitter or system is changed.

Settings.Name: Resimulate on Change While Paused
Settings.Description: Defines whether the Niagara Editor should rerun the simulation to the current time when making modifications while paused.

Settings.Name: Reset Dependent Systems when Editing Emitters
Settings.Description: Defines whether the Niagara Editor should reset all components that include the system currently being reset.

Settings.Name: Action Colors
Settings.Description: Define the colors for the source filtering options in the Niagara Create System wizard.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

Paper2D.Description: Reference for the Paper 2D section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Enable Sprite Atlas Groups
Settings.Description: Enables experimental texture atlas groups that sprites can be assigned to.

Settings.Name: Enable Terrain Spline Editing
Settings.Description: Enables experimental 2D terrain spline. Restart the Editor after enabling this setting.

Settings.Name: Resize Sprite Data to Match Textures
Settings.Description: Enables automatic resizing of various sprite data if the source texture gets resized.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

Python.Description: Reference for the Python section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Startup Scripts
Settings.Description: Array of Python scripts to run at startup. These run before the first Tick after the Engine initializes.

Settings.Name: Additional Paths
Settings.Description: Array of additional paths to add to the Python system paths.

Settings.Name: Isolate Interpreter Environment
Settings.Description: Defines whether the embedded interpreter should run in isolation mode. Prevents crashes due to incompatible software.

Settings.Name: Developer Mode (all users)
Settings.Description: Defines whether Developer Mode should be enabled on the Python interpreter for all users of the project. Enables extra warnings and stub code generation.

Settings.Name: Enable Remote Execution
Settings.Description: Defines whether remote Python execution should be enabled.

Settings.Name: Multicast Group Endpoint
Settings.Description: The multicast group endpoint (IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER) that the UDP multicast socket should join.

Settings.Name: Multicast Bind Address
Settings.Description: The adapter address that the UDP multicast socket should bind to, or 0.0.0.0 to bind to all adapters.

Settings.Name: Send Buffer Size
Settings.Description: Size of the send buffer for the remote endpoint connection.

Settings.Name: Receive Buffer Size
Settings.Description: Size of the receive buffer for the remote endpoint connection.

Settings.Name: Multicast Time-To-Live
Settings.Description: The TTL that the UDP multicast socket should use (0 is limited to the local host, 1 is limited to the local subnet).

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

ResonanceAudio.Description: Reference for the Resonance Audio section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Output Submix
Settings.Description: Reference to submix where reverb plugin audio is routed.

Settings.Name: Quality Mode
Settings.Description: Global Quality mode to use for directional sound sources.
Options: Binaural Low Quality: First Order Ambisonics
Binaural Medium Quality: Second Order Ambisonics
Binaural High Quality: Third Order Ambisonics (default)

Settings.Name: Global Reverb Preset
Settings.Description: Default settings for global reverb. Overridden when a player enters Audio Volumes.

Settings.Name: Global Source Preset
Settings.Description: Default settings for global source settings.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

TCPMessaging.Description: Reference for the TCP Messaging section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Enable Transport
Settings.Description: Defines whether the TCP transport channel is enabled.

Settings.Name: Listen Endpoint
Settings.Description: The IP endpoint to listen for incoming connections. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER. Leave blank to disable listening.

Settings.Name: Connect to Endpoints
Settings.Description: The IP endpoints to try to establish outgoing connection to. Use to connect to a remote peer. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER.

Settings.Name: Connection Retry Delay
Settings.Description: Delay time between attempts to re-establish outgoing connections. 0 disables reconnection.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

UDPMessaging.Description: Reference for the UDP Messaging section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Enabled by Default
Settings.Description: Defines whether UDP messaging is enabled by default. In shipping builds, ALLOW_UDP_MESSAGING_SHIPPING=1 must be defined in TargetRules.

Settings.Name: Enable Transport
Settings.Description: Defines whether the UDP transport channel should be enabled. Can be specified on the command line.

Settings.Name: Unicast Endpoint
Settings.Description: The IP endpoint to listen to and send packets from. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER.

Settings.Name: Multicast Endpoint
Settings.Description: The IP endpoint to send multicast packets to. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER. Multicast IP range: 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.

Settings.Name: Message Format
Settings.Description: The format used to serialize the UDP message payload.

Settings.Name: Auto-Repair
Settings.Description: Defines whether the UDP transport channel should try to auto-repair when in error.

Settings.Name: Max Send Rate
Settings.Description: Maximum sustained transmission rate in Gbit/s. Default is 1 Gbit/s.

Settings.Name: Auto-Repair Attempt Limit
Settings.Description: The number of consecutive attempts the auto-repair routine will try to repair.

Settings.Name: Multicast Time to Live
Settings.Description: The time-to-live (TTL) for sent multicast packets.

Settings.Name: Static Endpoints
Settings.Description: The IP endpoints of static devices. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER.

Settings.Name: Enable Tunnel
Settings.Description: Defines whether the UDP tunnel is enabled.

Settings.Name: Tunnel Unicast Endpoint
Settings.Description: The local IP endpoint to listen to and send packets from. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER.

Settings.Name: Tunnel Multicast Endpoint
Settings.Description: The IP endpoint to send multicast packets to. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER.

Settings.Name: Remote Tunnel Endpoints
Settings.Description: The IP endpoints of remote tunnel nodes. Use to connect to remote tunnel services. Format: IP_ADDRESS:PORT_NUMBER.

AdditionalResources.DeveloperForums: Ask questions and help your peers in the Developer Forums
AdditionalResources.LearningLibrary: Write your own tutorials or read those from others in the Learning Library

WMFMedia.Description: Reference for the WMF Media section of the Unreal Engine Project Settings.

Settings.Name: Allow Non Standard Codecs
Settings.Description: Defines whether to allow the loading of media that uses non-standard codecs (default = off).

Settings.Name: Low Latency
Settings.Description: Enable low latency processing in the Windows media pipeline (default = off).

Settings.Name: Hardware Accelerated Video Decoding (Experimental)
Settings.Description: Use hardware accelerated video acceleration (GPU) when possible, otherwise fall back to software implementation (CPU). Windows and DX11 only.

Settings.Name: Native Audio Out
Settings.Description: Play audio tracks via the operating system's native sound mixer (default = off).
